ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I really enjoyed the meetings where we critiqued others' talks - lots of helpful things to incorporate into my own work.
Received exposure to research being conducted within the Psychology department and outside of the institution. Developed skills in oral presentations.
This was a lab meeting-like seminar. I learned about ongoing projects people are working on and collaborating on.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: In my opinion, the structure of the course is too formal. Presentations are often very formal, and I think students would benefit more from being able to workshop ideas and problems with their research. Because the nature of the lab meetings feel so formal, students often do not feel comfortable speaking up so the meetings tend to be driven almost exclusively by the professors.

Strengths: great medium for collaborations Weaknesses: This seems silly but the classroom layout makes this feel more like a course than a collaborative space for brainstorming. A classroom in which people can sit around a table would help with this issue.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes - we talked about a nice variety of topics which I enjoyed.
Yes, is very beneficial to be exposed to other students research inside and outside of the department and to receive feedback on your own research.
If the student is very interested in developing collaborations with these labs, I would certainly recommend.
